subject: How do you unit test your Struts Actions with StrutsTestCase?
msgSnippet: Recently I encountered a problem with StrutsTestCase. The following code is my Struts Action and its dependent business logic is injected by Spring. public
messageBody:
Recently I encountered a problem with StrutsTestCase. The following
code is my Struts Action and its dependent business logic is injected
by Spring.

public class ListCourseAction extends Action {
private CourseService courseService;

public void setCourseService(CourseService courseService) {
this.courseService = courseService;
}

public ActionForward execute(ActionMapping mapping,
ActionForm form,
HttpServletRequest request,
HttpServletResponse response) throws
Exception {
Set allCourses = courseService.getAllCourses();
request.setAttribute("courses", allCourses);
return mapping.findForward("courseList");
}
}

Now I want to test this Action with StrutsTestCase and mock that
CourseService. But I don't know how to pass the mock object to my
action in StrutsTestCase. The only way I have found is to write
another Spring context config file and program pseudo business logic,
then inject them into my actions when testing. But I don't want to do
my test in that way.
There must be some kind of dependency between Struts Action and
business logic, and how do you deal with this case? How do you design
and test your Struts Actions?
